intro: Sanchezia sprucei, commonly known as the velvetleaf sterculia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. Sanchezia sprucei typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are showy, with five petals and a distinctive yellow center, making it a popular ornamental plant.
